Posts.Content: Jul 10, 2008 04:46PM Carolyn233 wrote: Hi....Just a little more info.  I am at a higher risk.  I have breast cancer on both sides of my family (3 aunts and 2 cousins)  as well as uterin, lymph node and lung cancer.  I'm going to see an oncologist on the 23rd for a second opinion and I will start the Tamoxifen and see how I do on it.  I can always quit if the side effects are too bad. Beesie:  My doc did tell me that I have about a 20% chance of getting cancer.  I know that leaves 80% of not, but it seems all I can think of is the 20%!  She said with the mastectomy it would be down to 1 - 2%.  She did tell me about a study that was done at the Mayo and I think it was 1500 women with Atypical hyperplasia that got masectomies and around 4 ended up getting breast cancer.  I could be off on my numbers but it was quite a significant percentage.  I'm very tempted to go to a Mayo doctor because it isn't too far from where I live. Thanks for the help.  I have a big decision to make.

Posts.Content: Carolyn233 wrote: I just finished with the million dollar workup. I had a surgical biopsy a couple of weeks ago and had two lumps removed. They were not cancerous yet. Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2008 11:14AM Carolyn233 wrote: Hi Falco, I myself couldn't just be happy and ignore it and it sounds like you can't either.  If your gut tells you somethings wrong than I would listen.  I had my mammo and they found two areas of interest. I then had an ultrasound, a breast gamma imaging test and then an MRI. I had an excisional biopsy on 6/20 and they took out two lumps about 2 1/2 cm each, which thank goodness were b9.  I don't think you're being paranoid at all!   It's the doctors job to do a thorough exam, even if you're hard to examine! Just my opinion.....

Posts.Content: Jul 16, 2008 01:42PM Carolyn233 wrote: Hi Journey,  I just had an excisional biopsy a couple of weeks ago.  I had two areas of "interest.'  They inserted the wire from one spot to the other.  I was a little concerned because it sounded painful, but it wasn't at all.  I have about a one inch scar.  Both my areas were on the outside closer to my armpit. My doc was able to make one incision and get both lumps as opposed to two incisions. It's still a tad tender mostly when I'm running, though.  Good luck.  Hope it all works out well. Carolyn
